revised_title: Kew Magnetic Data: Diurnal Inequalities of Horizontal and Vertical Force
tldr: The author analyzes the magnetic data collected at Kew Observatory from 1890 to 1900, focusing on diurnal inequalities of horizontal and vertical forces. They classify days as either ordinary or disturbed and discuss the methods used to analyze the data. The study helps to understand the regular and irregular variations in Earth's magnetic field and their potential impact on various phenomena.
